good.description: This is just the clothing, not the royal scepter, crown, ring, and other accoutrements. Royal clothes are ostentatious, with gems, gold, silk, and fur in abundance.

good.name: Outfit Scholar
good.description: Perfect for a scholar, this outfit includes a robe, a belt, a cap, soft shoes, and possibly a cloak.

good.name: Outfit Traveler
good.description: This set of clothes consists of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood.

good.name: Dog, riding
good.description: This Medium dog is specially trained to carry a Small humanoid rider. It is brave in combat like a warhorse. You take no damage when you fall from a riding dog.

good.name: Donkey
good.description: The best kinds of pack animals around, donkeys and mules are stolid in the face of danger, hardy, surefooted, and capable of carrying heavy loads over vast distances. Unlike a horse, a donkey or a mule is willing (though not eager) to enter dungeons and other strange or threatening places.

good.name: Mule
good.description: The best kinds of pack animals around, donkeys and mules are stolid in the face of danger, hardy, surefooted, and capable of carrying heavy loads over vast distances. Unlike a horse, a donkey or a mule is willing (though not eager) to enter dungeons and other strange or threatening places.

good.name: Feed (per day)
good.description: Horses, donkeys, mules, and ponies can graze to sustain themselves, but providing feed for them (such as oats) is much better because it provides a more concentrated form of energy, especially if the animal is exerting itself. If you have a riding dog, you have to feed it at least some meat, which may cost more or less than the given amount.

good.name: Horse, heavy
good.description: The horse is the best all-around work animal and mount in common use. A horse is suitable as a mount for a human, dwarf, elf, half-elf, or half-orc. Heavy horses are hard to control in combat (see Mounted Combat, Player's Handbook page 157, and the Ride skill, Player's Handbook page 80).

good.name: Horse, light
good.description: The horse is the best all-around work animal and mount in common use. A horse is suitable as a mount for a human, dwarf, elf, half-elf, or half-orc. Light horses are hard to control in combat (see Mounted Combat, Player's Handbook page 157, and the Ride skill, Player's Handbook page 80).

good.name: Pony
good.description: A pony is smaller than a horse and is a suitable mount for a gnome or halfling. Ponies are hard to control in combat (see Mounted Combat, Player's Handbook page 157, and the Ride skill, Player's Handbook page 80).

good.name: Warhorse, heavy
good.description: The horse is the best all-around work animal and mount in common use. A horse is suitable as a mount for a human, dwarf, elf, half-elf, or half-orc. Warhorses can be ridden easily into combat (see Mounted Combat, Player's Handbook page 157, and the Ride skill, Player's Handbook page 80).

good.name: Warhorse, light
good.description: The horse is the best all-around work animal and mount in common use. A horse is suitable as a mount for a human, dwarf, elf, half-elf, or half-orc. Warhorses can be ridden easily into combat (see Mounted Combat, Player's Handbook page 157, and the Ride skill, Player's Handbook page 80).

good.name: Warpony
good.description: A pony is a suitable mount for a gnome or halfling. Warponies can be ridden easily into combat (see Mounted Combat, Player's Handbook page 157, and the Ride skill, Player's Handbook page 80).

good.name: Saddle, military
good.description: A military saddle braces the rider, providing a +2 circumstance bonus on Ride checks related to staying in the saddle. If youâre knocked unconscious while in a military saddle, you have a 75% chance to stay in the saddle (compared to 50% for a riding saddle).

good.name: Saddle, pack
good.description: A pack saddle holds gear and supplies, but not a rider. It holds as much gear as the mount can carry.

good.name: Saddle, riding
good.description: The standard riding saddle supports a rider.

good.name: Saddle, exotic, Military
good.description: An exotic saddle is like a normal saddle of the same sort except that it is designed for an unusual mount, such as a hippogriff. Exotic saddles come in military, pack, and riding styles.

good.name: Saddle, exotic, pack
good.description: An exotic saddle is like a normal saddle of the same sort except that it is designed for an unusual mount, such as a hippogriff. Exotic saddles come in military, pack, and riding styles.

good.name: Saddle, exotic, riding
good.description: An exotic saddle is like a normal saddle of the same sort except that it is designed for an unusual mount, such as a hippogriff. Exotic saddles come in military, pack, and riding styles.
